title: RealMind: Real-Time AI Learning Hub
content:
Problem Statement
Web3 learners lack access to fast, interactive, and collaborative educational tools. Current platforms are often slow, fragmented, and fail to deliver engaging, real-time feedback. This makes it difficult for users—especially those new to Web3—to stay motivated, track progress, and learn efficiently.
Solution Overview
RealMind is an AI-powered, real-time learning platform designed specifically for the Web3 community. By leveraging Hyperion’s low-latency infrastructure and adaptive Alith AI agents, RealMind delivers instant content generation, live quizzes, and collaborative study sessions. On-chain progress tracking and seamless wallet onboarding ensure a transparent, gamified, and rewarding learning experience. Our approach uniquely combines the speed of Web2 with the transparency and ownership of Web3, creating a truly next-generation educational hub.
Project Description
RealMind reimagines digital learning as a fast, social, and intelligent experience for Web3 users. The core functionality centers around a wallet-connected dashboard where users access AI-generated flashcards, quizzes, and personalized notes. Real-time study rooms enable peer collaboration, live challenges, and group learning, all powered by Hyperion’s real-time technology and Alith’s AI co-agents for tailored feedback and adaptive learning paths.
Key features include:
Instant AI-powered content and quiz generation: Users receive personalized study materials and quizzes in real time.
Live study rooms and peer challenges: Learners can join or host collaborative sessions, compete in live quizzes, and work together on problem sets.
On-chain achievement tracking and tokenized rewards: Progress and achievements are transparently recorded on-chain, with NFTs and badges as proof of accomplishment.
Seamless wallet onboarding: Users access the platform quickly and securely with their Web3 wallets.
Adaptive Alith AI agents: Personalized feedback and dynamic learning recommendations keep users engaged and progressing.
Technologies considered include Hyperion’s low-latency stack, Alith AI for adaptive learning, and integration with Metis Layer 2 for scalable, on-chain verification. Users benefit from a frictionless, gamified learning journey that rewards participation and collaboration. What excites us most is the potential to empower a new generation of Web3 learners with tools that are as fast and social as the communities they serve.
Community Engagement Features
Testable Features/Tasks
Wallet Onboarding (+10 pts)
Create AI Flashcards (+15 pts)
Join/Host Live Study Session (+20 pts)
Challenge a Peer in Real-time (+20 pts)
Share an Achievement On-chain (+10 pts)
Points System
Each completed task earns points, tracked on a public leaderboard.
Unlock badges, NFTs, and exclusive content as you progress.
Referral bonuses and onboarding rewards for inviting friends.
Gamification & Onboarding
The points system and leaderboards foster friendly competition and engagement.
Badges and NFTs provide visible, on-chain recognition of achievements.
Guided onboarding and referral rewards accelerate user growth and community building.
Testable tasks ensure users experience the platform’s value from the start.
Getting Involved
Join the Beta: Sign up to test new features and provide feedback.
Contribute Code: Collaborate via our GitHub repository.
Community Forums & Events: Participate in discussions, AMAs, and live study sessions.
Ambassador Program: Lead study groups, host events, and help grow the RealMind community.
Propose Features: Suggest new AI integrations, gamification ideas, or learning modules.

title: Title: On-Chain LLM Interaction – A New Paradigm for Web3 Applications?
content:
One of the most unique aspects of the Metis Hyperion Testnet is its native support for AI execution, including the potential for on-chain interactions with large language models (LLMs). This isn’t just an infrastructure upgrade—it could fundamentally change how smart contracts, users, and dApps communicate and operate.
Right now, most LLMs are accessed through centralized APIs and operate off-chain. They’re powerful, but they depend heavily on trusted third parties. With Hyperion’s AI-native architecture, we may be seeing the first steps toward decentralized LLM reasoning that happens entirely within the blockchain environment.
Here are a few areas I think deserve deeper discussion:
Human-Language Interfaces for Smart Contracts
Imagine users interacting with smart contracts through natural language. A user could simply type a command like “swap 50 USDC to ETH with lowest fees,” and an on-chain LLM would parse, validate, and execute the request. This could eliminate the complexity barrier for non-technical users.
AI-Assisted Governance Proposals
LLMs could read, summarize, or even write DAO proposals based on real-time input from forums, code commits, or treasury reports. They could flag proposals with inconsistencies, or assist delegates in understanding complex policy updates before they vote.
Dynamic Protocol Behavior
Protocols could evolve based on AI-generated logic. For instance, a DeFi protocol could ask an LLM to analyze usage data and suggest a change in interest rates, fee models, or reward structures—all on-chain, governed by transparency and verifiability.
Modular AI Agents With Memory
Unlike traditional contracts, LLM agents could store interaction history and adjust behavior over time. This opens the door to intelligent agents that serve as customer support, on-chain mentors, or adaptive NPCs in gaming applications.
Challenges remain, of course—gas cost, model interpretability, and trust boundaries need to be addressed. But with Hyperion’s modular execution model and native AI capabilities, we’re closer than ever to meaningful, transparent LLM interactions on-chain.

title: How Can We Secure On-Chain AI Against Jailbreaks and Prompt Attacks?
content:
Someone asked me about preventation against hacker on the agents, i decide to make this topic and bring here. As Metis Hyperion moves toward enabling AI-native applications, including on-chain LLMs and autonomous agents, it opens up new frontiers—but also introduces serious security risks that Web3 has never dealt with before.
In traditional machine learning environments, we’ve already seen how easily language models can be manipulated with prompt injection, jailbreaking, or subtle adversarial inputs. Now imagine these vulnerabilities not in a closed API, but running directly on-chain where logic is permanent, transparent, and potentially high-stakes.
This raises the question: How do we prevent on-chain AI from being manipulated, abused, or exploited by malicious actors?
Here are a few areas I think we need to explore as a community:
Prompt Validation and Sanitization
Before any prompt reaches an on-chain LLM, there needs to be strict filtering, formatting, and intent verification. Just like how we validate transaction inputs, we may need decentralized prompt parsers that reject malformed or dangerous instructions.
On-Chain Prompt Reputation
We could design a system where prompts (or prompt creators) build a reputation score based on past behavior. If a user or dApp continuously submits prompts that lead to risky or abnormal outputs, their reputation could drop, and access could be limited or flagged.
Rule-Constrained Models
One way to reduce risk is to fine-tune LLMs with hard-coded boundaries. For example, an LLM powering a finance protocol should never generate prompts that execute transfers, change fees, or touch treasury funds unless additional authorization layers are triggered.
Sandboxed Execution for Agents
LLM-based agents could operate within a strict sandbox where they cannot execute arbitrary contract calls. Their responses would be suggestions, which must pass through a verification layer or human approval before actual execution.
AI-Specific Auditing Tools
Just as we audit smart contracts with tools like MythX or Slither, we’ll likely need new tools to simulate how LLMs respond to a wide range of inputs, including edge cases and adversarial examples. These tools would help identify vulnerabilities before deployment.
This is a new layer of risk for the blockchain space. Once you combine the transparency of public blockchains with the ambiguity of language models, new threat surfaces emerge—ones that smart contract logic alone cannot mitigate.

title: CERTHUB : Digital Certification Platform
content:
Project Name
CERTHUB (Digital Certification Hub): Decentralized Educational, Formal and Informal Credentials
Problem Statement
In today’s digital world, credential fraud costs the global economy over $30 billion annually, with 1 in 3 job applicants falsifying qualifications.
Traditional educational certificates are prone to fraud, clones,inaccessibility, with 20-30% of resumes containing falsified credentials and verification processes often taking a long time due to centralized manual systems.
Students, especially in underserved regions, struggle to access or share verifiable credentials, while institutions face high administrative costs and risks of data breaches and manipulation. This creates distrust, delays, and inequities in education and employment opportunities.
Solution Overview
CERTHUB is a blockchain-based platform for issuing, claiming, and verifying educational certificates as ERC1155 NFTs, ensuring tamper-proof, globally accessible credentials.
Using a factory contract to deploy gas-efficient proxy contracts of each certificate per institution, institutions can issue digital certificates, students can claim them via a mode of a merkle proof verified on-chain, and employers can verify them instantly on-chain via the platform.
Our approach is innovative due to its scalability, use of Merkle proofs for eligibility, and IPFS for decentralized metadata that contains descriptive details about what a certificate is representing and a web link pointing to the exact platform issuing the certificate, addressing fraud, inefficiency, and access barriers. Any certificate issued on this platform by any insitution can assured its global legitimacy.
Project Description
CERTHUB revolutionizes educational credentialing by enabling clients (institutions or any organization), to issue certificates as ERC1155 non-fungible tokens on the blockchain, with each certificate type managed by a proxy contract deployed via a call to the certificate factory contract (EducationalCertificateFactory). The registration and verification of legitimacy of these institutions and organizations that come to create a certificate will be done by the use of an AI Agent so avoid forgery and plagiarism of these instutions data by an external actor.
Upon successful verification of these clients, the Core features will include:
Issuance: Institutions deploy proxy contracts to mint tokens to the institutions wallet address, paste a list of addresses to the frontend, which will be hashed by the application to generate a merkle root and sent to the smart contract and root and proofs file will also will be automatically downloaded for the issuer to send to students via an external confidential link. The URI-metadata link (e.g., { "name": "Bachelor of Science 2025" }) stored on IPFS via a pinning platform, can be sent to the smart contract also. A new certificate of the same type can be re-issued or updated by the institution at a ny chosen interval.
Claiming: Students can come to input details (e.g., institution, certificate name, year) and their respective Merkle proofs that was generated by the application and sent to them by respective institutions , to claim their respective tokens to their wallets. This triggers a transfer of a token from the institutions address to their wallet upon successful verification of merkle proof by the smart contract and these tokens can only be claimed once by the receipient.
Verification: A verifyCertificate function will allow instant, trustless credential checks by employers or any third party to check the legitimacy of the certificate claim by the receipint on the platform.
Scalability: With each certificate deployment by an institution standing as an Independent token on-chain ,enabling for wallet and block-explorer’s recognition of the token name, the EIP-1167 minimal proxies will be used to reduce deployment costs by ~90% compared to full contracts.
Technologies include Solidity for smart contracts, IPFS for metadata storage by the Clients, and React for the frontend, with potential integration of The Graph for off-chain indexing. Students interact via a web interface, entering certificate details to claim tokens displayed in respective wallets (e.g MetaMask), while employers query the blockchain for verification. We’re excited about CERTHUB’s potential to eliminate fraud, streamline global hiring, and empower students in underserved regions with permanent, verifiable credentials, creating a new standard for trust in education.
1.Question: How could AI be integrated beyond institution verification - could CERTHUB leverage Hyperion’s AI co-agent or Alith to enhance certificate validation, metadata generation, or fraud detection mechanisms?
Response:
CERTHUB can extend AI integration beyond institution verification by leveraging Hyperion’s AI co-agent Alith to enhance certificate validation, metadata generation, and fraud detection, aligning with the Alith Integration Bonus Track and AI-Native Track. Here’s how:
a) Input Parsing: For example Alith can help read through a spread sheet of names and addresses containing valid students that should be able to come and claim a certificate, uploaded by an institution and help automatically extract valid wallet addresses in the spreadsheet and send them to the smart contract for a merkle root and proofs hashing.
b) Certificate Validation:
Alith Integration: Use Alith to perform real-time, on-chain analysis of certificate claims. Alith can cross-reference student data against external datasets (e.g.look up the name and wallet address in the former uploaded spreadsheet and cross check with the input given by the receipient, to verify eligibility before claimCertificate is executed. This reduces reliance on Merkle proofs alone, adding a dynamic validation and double factor authentication layer.
c) Integration with META-DATA: Leverage Alith to auto-generate IPFS metadata JSON for certificates. Alith can process institution inputs (e.g., certificate description to create standardized SEO-friendly metadata with attributes like name, image, and external_url.
Implementation: A frontend button triggers Alith to generate metadata (e.g., { “name”: “Bachelor of Science 2025”, “external_url”: “https://mit.edu/certificates/MIT-BS-2025” }), upload it to Pinning platform, and return the CID to the contract.
Benefit: Saves institutions time, ensures consistent metadata (critical for wallet display), and supports scalability for thousands of certificates.
d) Fraud Detection:
Deploy Alith as an on-chain fraud detection agent, analyzing transaction patterns (e.g., multiple claims from one address, unusual verification requests) to flag suspicious activity.
Real-Time Features and Hyperion’s Minimal Latency
Question: What real-time features does CERTHUB implement for certificate issuance, claiming, and verification processes, and how could Hyperion’s minimal latency infrastructure improve user experience during high-volume periods?
Response:
CERTHUB will implement real-time features for issuance, claiming, and verification with aid of leveraging Hyperion’s minimal latency infrastructure to ensure a seamless user experience especially during high-volume periods (e.g., graduation season). This aligns with the Real-Time Systems Track.
Current Real-Time Features:
Issuance: Institutions deploy proxy contracts via EducationalCertificateFactory.createCertificate, generating Merkle roots and proofs in the frontend (IssueCertificate.jsx). The transaction confirms in ~1-2 seconds on Hyperion’s testnet, minting tokens to the institution’s wallet instantly.
Claiming: Students claim tokens via claimCertificate, uploading Merkle proofs and triggering an on-chain transfer from the institution’s wallet. The frontend polls transaction status, updating the UI in real-time (e.g., “Certificate claimed!”).
Verification: The verifyCertificate function is a view call, returning isValid, studentName, and studentID instantly without gas costs, enabling employers to verify credentials in <1 second.
Hyperion’s Minimal Latency Improvements:
High-Volume Periods: Hyperion’s ultra-fast Layer 2 blockchain ensures CERTHUB handles thousands of simultaneous claims/verifications during peak times (e.g., 10,000 students claiming degrees post-graduation).
User Experience: Reduced latency minimizes frontend loading times, critical for regions with unstable internet. For example, a student in a rural area can claim a certificate in ~1 second compared to a layer 1 blockchain.

This forum is a place where we come together to discuss ideas, help each other, and build something meaningful.
Everyone’s welcome, and everyone’s contribution matters.

title: What it is web 3
content:
Welcome to the World of Web3!
Hi there! Let’s take a quick dive into Web3—a term you might have heard buzzing around tech circles. Don’t worry, we’ll keep it simple, friendly, and jargon-free!
What is Web3?
Web3 is the next evolution of the internet, designed to give *=you more control, privacy, and ownership over your online experience. Unlike today’s internet (often called Web2), where big companies manage platforms and data, Web3 shifts power back to users through decentralization—think of it as a community-driven internet!
Key Ideas Behind Web3:
Decentralization: No single entity owns or controls the network. Instead, data and decisions are spread across many participants (like a digital democracy!).
Blockchain Technology: This is the backbone of Web3! Blockchains (e.g., Ethereum) are secure, transparent ledgers that record transactions and power things like cryptocurrencies and NFTs.
Ownership: In Web3, you own your data, digital assets, and identity—not corporations. Imagine truly owning your social media posts or virtual items!
Smart Contracts: Self-executing agreements that run automatically when conditions are met. No middlemen needed!
Why Should You Care?
More Control: Decide how your data is used.
Trust & Transparency: Blockchains make processes open and tamper-proof.
New Opportunities: From earning crypto rewards to participating in decentralized apps (dApps), Web3 opens doors to innovation.
Examples of Web3 in Action
Cryptocurrencies: Like Bitcoin or Ethereum.
NFTs: Unique digital art or collectibles you can truly own.
DAOs (Decentralized Autonomous Organizations): Community-led groups where members vote on decisions.
A Friendly Reminder
Web3 is still evolving, and not everything is perfect yet (think energy use or tech complexity). But its vision—a fairer, user-centric internet—is exciting!
Whether you’re a creator, investor, or curious learner, Web3 invites you to reimagine the future of the web. Ready to explore?
Let’s build a better internet—together!

title: Proposal for a Decentralized Ecosystem Integrating Cross-Chain Transfers, Liquidity Solutions, and Staking on Metis Governance
content:
Proposal for a Decentralized Ecosystem Integrating Cross-Chain Transfers, Liquidity Solutions, and Staking on Metis Governance
Introduction
This proposal outlines a comprehensive ecosystem designed to enhance interoperability, liquidity efficiency, and decentralized governance within the Metis network. By integrating cross-chain transfer capabilities, incentivizing liquidity provision, and enabling staking mechanisms for governance participation, this ecosystem aims to position Metis as a leading platform for scalable, user-centric DeFi solutions.
Cross-Chain Transfer Infrastructure
Objective: Enable seamless asset and data transfers between Metis and other blockchain networks (e.g., Ethereum, Polygon, BNB Chain) to eliminate fragmentation and expand user accessibility.
Proposed Features:
Cross-Chain Bridges: Deploy trustless, audited bridges to facilitate secure transfers of tokens and NFTs.
Unified Interface: Create a user-friendly dashboard for cross-chain swaps, transaction tracking, and fee estimation.
Security Protocols: Implement multi-signature wallets, zero-knowledge proofs, and third-party audits to minimize risks.
Benefits:
Broader user adoption by connecting Metis to major blockchain ecosystems.
Enhanced utility for METIS tokens as the native gas and governance asset.
Liquidity Enhancement Mechanisms
Objective: Ensure deep, sustainable liquidity pools to support trading, lending, and yield generation across Metis-based dApps.
Proposed Features:
Incentivized Liquidity Pools: Reward liquidity providers (LPs) with METIS tokens, governance power, or fee-sharing models.
Dynamic Fee Structures: Adjust fees based on market conditions to balance LP rewards and trader affordability.
Liquidity Aggregation: Partner with cross-chain protocols to pool liquidity from external sources (e.g., Uniswap, Curve).
Benefits:
Reduced slippage and improved capital efficiency for traders and LPs.
Attraction of institutional and retail participants through competitive yields.
Staking for Governance Participation
Objective: Empower METIS holders to actively shape the network’s future through staking-based governance.
Proposed Features:
Staking Contracts: Allow users to lock METIS tokens to earn voting rights and rewards.
Tiered Governance: Introduce tiers (e.g., staking amounts or durations) to determine voting weight and reward levels.
Proposal Dashboard: Develop a transparent platform for submitting, debating, and voting on governance proposals.
Benefits:
Decentralized decision-making aligned with long-term ecosystem growth.
Increased token utility, encouraging long-term holding and network security.
Implementation Roadmap
Phase 1 (Q1 2026):
Audit and deploy cross-chain bridges.
Launch initial liquidity mining programs on Metis.
Phase 2 (Q2 2026):
Release governance staking contracts and voting interface.
Integrate liquidity aggregation tools.
Phase 3 (Q3 2026):
Expand cross-chain partnerships and optimize fee structures.
Introduce advanced governance features (e.g., delegated voting).
Conclusion
By combining cross-chain interoperability, robust liquidity solutions, and community-driven governance, this ecosystem will solidify Metis as a hub for innovation and user empowerment in DeFi. We invite stakeholders to collaborate on refining and executing this vision, ensuring Metis remains competitive, secure, and aligned with its community’s needs.

title: Metis Hyperion
content:
Metis, Ethereum ağı üzerinde ölçeklenebilirlik sağlamayı amaçlayan bir Katman 2 çözümüdür. Hyperion ise Metis’in bu alandaki en yeni ve iddialı geliştirmelerinden biridir. Temel özellikleri şunlardır:
Yapay Zeka Odaklılık: Hyperion, yapay zeka uygulamalarının blok zinciri üzerinde verimli bir şekilde çalışmasını sağlamak üzere optimize edilmiştir. Büyük Dil Modelleri (LLM) gibi AI modellerinin doğrudan zincir üzerinde çalıştırılabilmesi hedeflenmektedir.
Yüksek Performans: Geleneksel Layer 2 çözümlerine kıyasla daha yüksek hız ve verim sunmayı amaçlar. Paralel işlem yürütme ve merkeziyetsiz sıralama gibi teknolojilerle işlem hızını artırır.
Ölçeklenebilirlik: MetisVM ve MetisDB gibi Metis teknolojilerini kullanarak depolama ve işlem kapasitesini geliştirir.
Ethereum Uyumluluğu: Ethereum ile sorunsuz bir şekilde entegre olabilir ve mevcut Ethereum geliştiricilerinin Metis altyapısını kullanarak kendi dApp’lerini (merkeziyetsiz uygulamalarını) oluşturmasına olanak tanır.
Çift Zincir Yapısı: Metis ekosisteminde Andromeda (genel amaçlı dApp’ler için optimize edilmiş) ve Hyperion (yapay zeka ve yüksek performans için optimize edilmiş) olmak üzere iki ana Layer 2 bulunmaktadır. Bu dualite, geliştiricilere ihtiyaçlarına göre esnek dağıtım seçenekleri sunar.
Metis Hyperion Hakkında Yorumlar ve Kullanıcı Deneyimleri
Metis Hyperion, henüz testnet aşamasında olan nispeten yeni bir gelişmedir. Bu nedenle, geniş çaplı kullanıcı deneyimi ve yorumlar henüz sınırlıdır. Ancak mevcut bilgiler ışığında şunlar söylenebilir:
Potansiyel ve Heyecan: Kripto topluluğunda ve özellikle yapay zeka entegrasyonuna ilgi duyan çevrelerde büyük bir beklenti ve heyecan yaratmıştır. Yapay zekanın blok zincirine entegrasyonu, geleceğin dApp’leri için önemli bir adım olarak görülüyor.
Teknolojik İddialar: Hyperion’un vaat ettiği “AI-native” (yapay zeka yerlisi) Layer 2, paralel işlem yürütme ve merkeziyetsiz sıralama gibi teknik özellikler, sektörde dikkat çekmektedir.
Geliştirici Odaklılık: Metis, Hyperion için geliştirici rozetleri ve teşvik programları gibi yollarla topluluğu ve geliştiricileri aktif olarak katılım sağlamaya teşvik ediyor. Bu, projenin büyümesi ve benimsenmesi için önemli bir faktör.
İşlem Hacmi ve Fiyat Etkisi: Metis’in (METIS) genel işlem hacmi ve piyasa değeri, projenin ve Hyperion gibi yeni geliştirmelerin piyasada nasıl algılandığını gösteriyor. Hyperion gibi gelişmelerin METIS fiyatı üzerinde olumlu bir etkisi olabileceği düşünülüyor.
Özetle
Metis Hyperion, blok zinciri ve yapay zeka kesişiminde önemli bir gelişmeyi temsil ediyor. Yüksek performanslı ve AI odaklı bir Layer 2 olarak, gelecekteki merkeziyetsiz yapay zeka uygulamaları için temel bir altyapı sağlamayı hedefliyor. Henüz yolun başında olsa da, vaat ettikleri ve Metis ekibinin bu yöndeki çalışmaları, Hyperion’u takip etmeye değer bir proje haline getiriyor.

Metis, Ethereum ağı üzerinde ölçeklenebilirlik sağlamayı amaçlayan bir Katman 2 çözümüdür. Hyperion ise Metis’in bu alandaki en yeni ve iddialı geliştirmelerinden biridir. Temel özellikleri şunlardır:
Yapay Zeka Odaklılık: Hyperion, yapay zeka uygulamalarının blok zinciri üzerinde verimli bir şekilde çalışmasını sağlamak üzere optimize edilmiştir. Büyük Dil Modelleri (LLM) gibi AI modellerinin doğrudan zincir üzerinde çalıştırılabilmesi hedeflenmektedir.
Yüksek Performans: Geleneksel Layer 2 çözümlerine kıyasla daha yüksek hız ve verim sunmayı amaçlar. Paralel işlem yürütme ve merkeziyetsiz sıralama gibi teknolojilerle işlem hızını artırır.
Ölçeklenebilirlik: MetisVM ve MetisDB gibi Metis teknolojilerini kullanarak depolama ve işlem kapasitesini geliştirir.
Ethereum Uyumluluğu: Ethereum ile sorunsuz bir şekilde entegre olabilir ve mevcut Ethereum geliştiricilerinin Metis altyapısını kullanarak kendi dApp’lerini (merkeziyetsiz uygulamalarını) oluşturmasına olanak tanır.
Çift Zincir Yapısı: Metis ekosisteminde Andromeda (genel amaçlı dApp’ler için optimize edilmiş) ve Hyperion (yapay zeka ve yüksek performans için optimize edilmiş) olmak üzere iki ana Layer 2 bulunmaktadır. Bu dualite, geliştiricilere ihtiyaçlarına göre esnek dağıtım seçenekleri sunar.
Metis Hyperion Hakkında Yorumlar ve Kullanıcı Deneyimleri
Metis Hyperion, henüz testnet aşamasında olan nispeten yeni bir gelişmedir. Bu nedenle, geniş çaplı kullanıcı deneyimi ve yorumlar henüz sınırlıdır. Ancak mevcut bilgiler ışığında şunlar söylenebilir:
Potansiyel ve Heyecan: Kripto topluluğunda ve özellikle yapay zeka entegrasyonuna ilgi duyan çevrelerde büyük bir beklenti ve heyecan yaratmıştır. Yapay zekanın blok zincirine entegrasyonu, geleceğin dApp’leri için önemli bir adım olarak görülüyor.
Teknolojik İddialar: Hyperion’un vaat ettiği “AI-native” (yapay zeka yerlisi) Layer 2, paralel işlem yürütme ve merkeziyetsiz sıralama gibi teknik özellikler, sektörde dikkat çekmektedir.
Geliştirici Odaklılık: Metis, Hyperion için geliştirici rozetleri ve teşvik programları gibi yollarla topluluğu ve geliştiricileri aktif olarak katılım sağlamaya teşvik ediyor. Bu, projenin büyümesi ve benimsenmesi için önemli bir faktör.
İşlem Hacmi ve Fiyat Etkisi: Metis’in (METIS) genel işlem hacmi ve piyasa değeri, projenin ve Hyperion gibi yeni geliştirmelerin piyasada nasıl algılandığını gösteriyor. Hyperion gibi gelişmelerin METIS fiyatı üzerinde olumlu bir etkisi olabileceği düşünülüyor.
Özetle
Metis Hyperion, blok zinciri ve yapay zeka kesişiminde önemli bir gelişmeyi temsil ediyor. Yüksek performanslı ve AI odaklı bir Layer 2 olarak, gelecekteki merkeziyetsiz yapay zeka uygulamaları için temel bir altyapı sağlamayı hedefliyor. Henüz yolun başında olsa da, vaat ettikleri ve Metis ekibinin bu yöndeki çalışmaları, Hyperion’u takip etmeye değer bir proje haline getiriyor.

title: Hyperion launch campaign- Learn more
content:
The Hyperion Launch Campaign: A Multi-Phase Journey from Testnet to Mainnet
We’re excited to introduce the Hyperion Launch Campaign, a 3-phase journey designed to drive real-time, AI-native Web3 forward. This is more than just a launch; it’s where early contributors like you become core builders of the Hyperion ecosystem. The campaign will take us from Testnet to Mainnet, and we want YOU to be a part of it!
Here’s an overview of the 4-month campaign:
Phase 1: Testnet Launch → Forum Launch + HyperHack Kickoff
This phase marks the beginning of our journey. With the Testnet live, the Forum is launched, and the HyperHack hackathon kicks off! This is your chance to get involved early, test the infrastructure, and start building in a collaborative environment.
Phase 2: Build & Hype → Vibe Sessions, Builder Badges, Battle Tests, Sage Rewards, Premium Wallets, House Showdowns
The second phase is all about building and amplifying the excitement. We’ll be hosting Vibe Sessions, rewarding builders with badges, running battle tests on dApps, and offering exciting Sage Rewards and Premium Wallets for active participants. Plus, join the fun with House Showdowns!
Phase 3: Mainnet Launch → HyperHack Winners Announced
The final phase culminates in the Mainnet Launch, where we’ll announce the HyperHack winners. This is where all the hard work pays off, and we transition to a fully operational network with real-time, high-performance decentralized applications.
How to Get Involved
Join the Forum: Contribute to discussions, help shape the ecosystem, and earn points and recognition for your contributions.
Join HyperHack: Participate in our three-month hackathon to build and battle-test dApps. This is your chance to showcase your skills and make an impact on the future of Web3!
Engage in the Forum: Get recognized and be rewarded!
Join Guilds: Contribute & Grow
This is more than just a launch; it’s an opportunity to become part of something bigger. The Hyperion Launch Campaign allows you to grow from an early adopter into a core contributor, a builder of tomorrow’s AI-native Web3 ecosystem.

title: [Tutorial] How to Apply and Submit a Proposal
content:
How to Apply
1. Read this Ideathon Pinned Post
2. Request to join hackathon
Go to Hyperion Initiators Group and request to join the hackathon by clicking the “Request” button at the top right corner of the page.
3. Fill form
A sample template for the application form will appear. Complete the application form with:
Project Title
Problem Statement
Solution Overview
Project Description
Community Engagement Features
After completing the form, hit “Submit Request” button.
4. Wait for verdict
After submitting the form, the committee will receive your application and will process it within 1 working day
Developers will be informed of their approval via forum notifications and email.
The notification of approval looks like this:
By clicking the approval notification, the forum navigates back to the application, and an approval message can be seen in the replies
You can copy the text of the application because it will be needed for the proposal
5. Write a Proposal to the Forum
Developers should write a proposal to the Ideathon Category with their submission for the community to discuss and to track updates to the project.
Approved developers now can write proposals to the Ideathon category by clicking on the “New Topic” button
An editor prompt will show and the proposal can be pasted into the body of the editor

And by clicking on “Create Topic” we will be able to see our topic on the Ideathon Category
Users and committee will be able to comment on the proposals
You may use the same text from your application form for your proposal, or refer to this template
